column4: hey guys, I'm using ubuntu 11.04 my whole system is using the standard theme (dark title bars with orange X, etc.  But, my menu system uses it for just a little while, while logging in, then it switches back to an old windows 3.1 style super 3d buttons look.  Any ideas?
log off and back on again
done that MANY times, doesn't do anything.
Not sure, but it was working in 10.10, just a sec, I'll look
ok open a terminal and type   lspci | grep -i vga
yeah, was about to do that, just a sec.
ATI Technologies Inc Mobility Radeon HD 3650
I'm not using the proprietary drive
Or, I don't think I switched to that.

mm  ok I know nothing about ati,, I was hoping it was nvidia because then I would suggest uninstalling that driver then reinstalling since it most likely a different driver version..hoewver for ati I  have no idea
the problems with upgrades is many times old config files are left behind
I deleted .gnome* and that did nothing.
but if it was a "driver issue" then why the windows look fine, but the menu/task bar system don't?
good question ,,but I dont have a good answer for you ,, sorry
I'm going to try and do the disable effects thing, and see what happens.
